text: In addition, schists contain smaller amounts of other minerals, often quartz and feldspar.
As with slate, the parent rock of most schists is shale that has undergone mediumto high-grade metamorphism during a major mountainbuilding episode.
Phyllite Phyllite represents a degree of metamorphism between slate and schist.
Schist Medium- to coarse-grained metamorphic rocks in which platy minerals are dominant are called schists.
Phyllite exhibits rock cleavage and is composed mainly of very fine crystals of mainly muscovite, chlorite, or both.
Its constituent platy minerals are larger than those in slate but not large enough to be readily identifiable with the unaided eye.
These flat components commonly include muscovite and biotite that display parallel alignments that give the rock its foliated texture .
Some schists are composed mostly of dark minerals (such as amphiboles).
Although phyllite appears similar to slate, it can be easily distinguished from slate by its glossy sheen and wavy surface .
